page.title: 13Recreation in Blechingley.
page.content: B.A.D.S. stands for Blechingley Amateur Dramatic Society. They are a group of people from the Tandridge and Redhill areas who produce a pantomime annually and sometimes a small play during the year.One such play was,"Blythe Spirit," by Noel Coward. It was about a man haunted by the ghost of his first wife ending with the death of his second wife and his subsequent haunting by both wives. The scenery and effects were brilliant. In 1984, August brought a disaster when their rehearsal hut was gutted. Building new scenery and rehearsing in the remainder hut, they somehow produced a pantomime that Christmas.
